heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 03 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (183°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 6.0°C), feels like temperature (down 5.4°C), and inside temperature (down 2.1°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 7.2°C), dew point temperature (up 5.4°C), outside temperature (up 6.7°C), and cloud levels (up 391 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 589.2m lower than yesterday, 261.9m lower than the past week, 391.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 1297m and a peak of 2830m, averaging 1283.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; cool or mild temperatures. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and very little to no wind will be present. Showers, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and the light is absent. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (5.7°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
